column2: et populī meditātī sunt inānia? ^ Why have the Gentiles raged
column3: and the people devised vain things?

column2: et prīncipēs convēnērunt in ūnum adversus Dominum
column3: et adversus chrīstum ejus. ^ The kings of the earth stood up

column2: et prōjiciāmus ā nōbīs jugum ipsōrum. ^ Let us break their bonds asunder
column3: and let us cast away their yoke from us.

column1: 4 ^ Quī habitat in caelīs irrīdēbit eōs
column2: et Dominus subsannābit eōs. ^ He that dwelleth in heaven shall laugh at them
column3: and the Lord shall deride them.

column1: 5 ^ Tunc loquētur ad eōs in īrā suā
column2: et in furōre suō conturbābit eōs. ^ Then shall he speak to them in his anger
column3: and trouble them in his rage.

column1: 6 ^ Egō autem constitūtus sum rēx ab eō super Sion montem sānctum ejus
column2: praedicans praeceptum ejus. ^ But I am appointed king by him over Sion

column1: 7 ^ Dominus dīxit ad mē: Fīlius meus es tū
column2: egō hodiē genuī tē. ^ The Lord hath said to me: Thou art my son
column3: this day have I begotten thee.

column2: et dabō tibi Gentēs hērēditātem tuam
column3: et possessiōnem tuam terminōs terrae. ^ Ask of me
column4: and I will give thee the Gentiles for thy inheritance
column5: and the utmost parts of the earth for thy possession.

column2: et tamquam vās figulī confringēs eōs. ^ Thou shalt rule them with a rod of iron
column3: and shalt break them in pieces like a potter's vessel.

column2: et exsultāte eī cum tremōre. ^ Serve ye the Lord with fear
column3: and rejoice unto him with trembling.
et periātis dē viā jūstā. ^ Embrace discipline
column4: lest at any time the Lord be angry
column5: and you perish from the just way.

column1: 13 ^ Quum exarserit in brevī īra ejus
column2: beātī omnēs quī confīdunt in eō. ^ When his wrath shall be kindled in a short time
column3: blessed are all they that trust in him.
